Line 13: Line 13:  
* be informed by multiple forms of [[intelligence (trait)|intelligence]] – [[reason]], [[intuition]], heart, [[spirit]], etc..
 
* be informed by multiple forms of [[intelligence (trait)|intelligence]] – [[reason]], [[intuition]], heart, [[spirit]], etc..
    −
Because of its expanded perspective, wisdom is also often associated with [[humility]], [[compassion]], [[composure]], and being able to [[laugh]] at oneself.Many [[liberal]]s would argue a tolerance for [[dissonance]], [[paradox]], [[nuance]], [[ambiguity]], [[uncertainty]] is also important.
+
Because of its expanded perspective, wisdom is also often associated with [[humility]], [[compassion]], [[composure]], and being able to [[laugh]] at oneself. Many [[liberal]]s would argue a tolerance for [[dissonance]], [[paradox]], [[nuance]], [[ambiguity]], [[uncertainty]] is also important.
     
In its most universal and useful forms, wisdom tends to sense, work with and align people to the intrinsic [[wholeness]] and [[interconnectedness]] of life.
 
In its most universal and useful forms, wisdom tends to sense, work with and align people to the intrinsic [[wholeness]] and [[interconnectedness]] of life.
Line 19: Line 19:  
As with all decisions, a wise decision is made from incomplete [[information]]. But in a wise decision the chooser possesses a sense of the way that situations usually turn out and, in its deeper forms, a desire for the outcome to be broadly beneficial.
 
As with all decisions, a wise decision is made from incomplete [[information]]. But in a wise decision the chooser possesses a sense of the way that situations usually turn out and, in its deeper forms, a desire for the outcome to be broadly beneficial.
    −
Classically, wisdom is considered to come with age. In some religions, wisdom is considered a gift granted by [[God]].The [[Jewish]] book of [[Proverbs]] in the [[Old Testament]] states `Fear of God is the beginning of Wisdom`.
+
Classically, wisdom is considered to come with age. In some religions, wisdom is considered a gift granted by [[God]]. The [[Jewish]] book of [[Proverbs]] in the [[Old Testament]] states `Fear of God is the beginning of Wisdom`.
     
A wise person is often called a "sage."
 
A wise person is often called a "sage."
